title: Timucuan Ecological & Historic Preserve: Visiting Kingsley Plantation
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Places     Kingsley Plantation     Visiting Kingsley Plantation                  Visiting Kingsley Plantation      Kingsley Plantation is open seven days a week, from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., except on Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, and New Years Day. Admission is free. You can explore the grounds at Kingsley Plantation, which include the slave quarters, barn, waterfront, plantation house, kitchen house, and interpretive garden. The visitor contact station/bookstore is located in a 1920s building adjacent to the plantation buildings.   Touring the Plantation House The plantation house is closed during the week for structural work.  Weekend tours are available on a limited basis at 11:00 a.m. and 3 p.m., please call ahead for reservations.  If you have any questions about this project, please call the park at (904) 251-3537 (alternate phone 904.251.3626) or choose a link below. Building Closures Directions Brochures For Kids For Teachers Events Pets are allowed in outdoor areas, but must be on a six-foot leash. Feel free to call the park at 904.251.3537.  Â     Kingsley Plantation is located along the Fort George River on Fort George Island. D. Herring
